title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed. The actual result is that there are no children nodes listed after changing the data source. This issue can be reproduced by following these steps: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page and change the data source. 3. The new data source has no database/table/column information. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
SR: To reproduce the bug: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source. 4. Verify that the new data source has no database/table/column information. The expected behavior is that the children node listing should be displayed after changing the data source. Close the data set editor and reopen it to confirm.
